name: Jeannabeanna Stephens
text: Don't know where to start. Most people like this place, but don't go if you don't know what you want. I told them my symptoms (and meds) and was pushed to buy 2 products. Got home to research and both items interfered with my medications. Taking items back is like you broke some major rule. It is frowned upon. Not that they care, but I won't be back.

resp.text:
Jeanna, I am so sorry about your experience, and I hope that you will change your mind and give us another chance. Our employees are not allowed to give medical advice. Our policy is to tell you to talk to your pharmacist about possible interactions. That being said, the internet is NOT a good place to research that information. I implore you to ask your pharmacist.

As for feeling frowned upon for a return, please understand that we are human and are capable of allowing our emotions to show on our sleeve as much as anyone, but I will talk to the employee that assisted you and let her know that she made you feel badly.

Again, I apologize for your experience and hope that you will give us a chance to make it right.

text:
Walked in for the first time today. I came in with my husband, he and the associate talked about products for a while and my husband's time in the Marines came up. I let them talk for a while and browsed around, figuring my husband was getting the help he needed.

When they broke so that we could browse, the associate asked if I was also in the military and I said no. To this he said "Oh, so you let him do all the hard work?" What am I supposed to take from this? Does he think I have it so easy? This was just such a rude and presumptuous thing to say. I was so ticked I wanted to leave right away.

UPDATED:
The owner has been very understanding about the event and I'm glad he reached out to me to try to make things right. I really do appreciate his efforts and I've updated my rating to reflect this.

name: Satoshi Nakamoto
text: Great products, very organized! The reason I'm giving you 3 stars is because your sales service seems to be misinformed and quite rude. I came in today (5/30/17) for creatine monohydrate. I left with nothing. The young girl running the store today asked why monohyrdate and when I voiced my "opinion" of this being the most researched and proven form of creatine I was scoffed at. This was baffling because I assumed her to have experience being the only one present in the store. Anyone with experience in the fitness industry knows this statement to be factual. The National Center for Biotechnology and Information as well as the International Society of Sports Nutrition have published many medical journals/articles regarding this. Okay, so maybe she was trying to sell me another product, fine I understand it's a business. It doesn't stop there though. Then she proceeds to tell me that another product creatine glycerol phosphate is superior to creatine monohydrate and all of Metabolic Nutrition's products have been evaluated by the FDA. This was quite concerning. First of all, you are misleading people. The FDA does not regulate dietary supplements. I showed her on the bottle where it clearly says "These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to treat, cure, prevent or diagnose any disease". I explained this by referencing the H.R.4771 - Designer Anabolic Steroid Control Act of 2014. My point behind this was the only time the FDA steps in for supplements is after they have been to the shelf in stores and caused problems. She informs me that the act did not stop Pro-Hormones from being sold and asked if I was going to run and tell on them for selling them.. REALLY?? Furthermore, she had no knowledge of how the other product was superior. She told me she believed this product to be better because of what other customers have told her. Hearsay and reading the label, assuming it to be factual is not very scientific. If you want to sell a product this is not the way to do it! Additionally, I would like to say on my last visit to Absolute the service I received from Jordan was excellent. He was quite experienced, friendly, and informed regarding the products we discussed. Overall I probably won't let this incident stop me from shopping here, but in my opinion misleading people from the truth should not go unheard and if you don't know the truth perhaps you shouldn't be speaking.

resp.text:
Hi Mitchell,

I'm very sorry to hear your experience with us today was a negative one. Would you mind sending me an email to Matt@AbsoluteNutritionOnline.com? I'd like a chance to speak with you personally if possible. - Matt

name: Maria García
text: I don't usually post a bad review but this past Thursday 2/7/19 when I went to go get a smoothie and a cleanse I wasn't aware that the times changed because I usually come on my lunch break, but I got there at about 6:55 because I thought they closed at 8. The manager molly let me in but she was very rude to me in others that were in there. I assume we all came late? I understand that the closing time has changed but I customers should come first. I've meet molly before at an event that was at Belks a while ago but when I come to the store its like shes a different person. All the staff is usually nice though, but that night was just really sad and highly UNPROFESSIONAL! Just the way she was slamming the doors and the blenders and her attitude was just poor. Over all they have some nice smoothies and juices.

resp.text:
We’re so sorry to hear about this, Maria. Thank you for your feedback! As you referenced in your review, our staff is known for their great attitudes and service. Our staff is made up of this community and serves this community whole-heartedly inside and outside of the store. Please allow us to provide your next clean juice experience on us. 💚

Jason, our store manager, has been informed. 😁 We look forward to seeing you again soon! 🙏🏻

name: Rachelle Wallace
text: Not very wise.  I was just refused service because I didn't have a mask.  As a chronic asthma sufferer I can't breathe in a mask that is effective against this virus.  I used to live in Montgomery and shop here all the time.  I  came to town for boot repair and was going to shop but you lost me for good.

resp.text:
Hello Rachelle - I couldn't agree more sincerely with you that it is "not very wise" - that is your statement, for you, it you do have chronic asthma, to be out and about in this possibly infectious time without some type of facial covering.

In no way has it been verbally stated, written or implied that someone has to wear an n95 procedural or surgical mask to enter. Our sign, placed in front of the door where you actually have to read it and go around it to access the door states, and I quote exactly: "ATTENTION - IF YOU DO NOT HAVE A MASK OR FACIAL COVERING, PLEASE STAY OUTSIDE. WE WILL CURBSIDE YOUR ORDER. CALL 334-277-9925.

The sign also states: "DUE TO THE RISK OF CONTAMINATION, ALL SALES ARE FINAL - NO REFUNDS."

You were not refused service as you have incorrectly stated - you were refused entrance to the INSIDE of our business since you had no facial covering. You were given the option to our curb side service - which you refused to take advantage of. We provide a nice, socially distanced safe outside sitting area for those without masks or facial coverings to use. We actually have a large amount of customers who prefer the outdoor curbside service and delivery option.

We require this of everyone - regardless of race, color, gender, religious or political orientation. Why you consider yourself some elite exception in that you feel that you have some special entitlement, are better than all our other customers,  and can disregard our store policy, which has been in effect for many months now, I do not know - and there are no exceptions to our store entrance policy. We are a privately owned and operated local, family business - and we set the store policy here.

You are not entitled or above all our other customers who follow the store policy and are very, very happy to be able to shop in such a sanitary, healthy and very friendly 32+ year service and community oriented business

All of us wear our correct facial coverings all day long. We do take short breaks from wearing the coverings when not in the store to allow for C02 reduction and etc - but are right back on when back inside the store.

Funny, but no one here remembers anyone of your mask intolerance issue trying to come in. What ever - there is an outside curbside service area for those reading this post who may have some type of facial mask/covering issue that can benefit from this incident, and know there is an outside curbside service option for them.

We  hope you find your happy place to shop. We are extremely busy assisting our correctly attired and extremely satisfied multi-generational customers.

name: Ty Callahan
text: Although the products can sell themselves employees aren't friendly at all and even if you're spending a lot of money they will give you the wrong item and when you correct them they will try to tell you what THEY use... Like no I asked for this kind and I'm paying. NOW you wanna tell me what you use. Felt like a drug deal or something. Poor customer service maybe racist/biased, I don't know but I know I  felt my business was NOT appreciated will DEFINITELY go somewhere else going forward. Edit: And  I didnt look for manager or ask for names as from atmosphere from the particular employee i was immediately turned off.. And as someone cleverly cross-examines me as "reply" from "management" below I don't feel any different from my experience prior.

resp.text: Hello Ty...have no idea what you were looking for since you weren't working with either me, Willard or Matt...who are the upper management and who one should go to if there is some issue that didn't meet your expectations...you obviously don't frequent our store to know our 30 plus years and history offering 3 generations of persons of all races, religions, orientations and etc to even use the racial bias statement. Since you did not attempt to speak with myself, Willard or Matt...and discuss your issue...that makes it difficult to know and understand your statements...our 3 generational loyal and very appreciative customers know from long term experience that we are a caring business that serves persons of all colors, or whatever differences with equal appreciation and attention...the young cash register clerks are nothing but that and are not meant to give advise or tips on anything other than where products are and to assist you in the checkout process...questions over and above that level should be directed to the management level if seeking advise of any kind...we apoligise in advance if your experience was not what you were looking for, and wish you health and wellness, and we hope you find your happiness in shopping where you so choose...racial bias is not a practise allowed at our business. We wouldn't have been in business for 32 years in Montgomery Alabama where at least half of our customer base are persons of color and different cultural and religious persuasions...also...in closing...let me thank you for your review and any other similar post claiming an inequity or racial bias...your post has actually brought in even more business from our cutomer base calling and coming in to shop and support our loving and caring business even more...best free advertising in a while...so many thanks again...

name: Shenee Furr
text: Steve is amazing he had no problem with help my mom and I find items we were looking for ...Thanks Steve..

resp.text: Thank You Shenee for your post! We try out best to help each and everyone we can! Stay safe!

name: Rosemary Perdue
text:
i have been doing business with Health Wise Foods since 2010 when i discovered the store while taking Hot Yoga classes in the basement.  Then when i got sick.... i became a frequent customer.  The owners, Management and staff have all been supportive, friendly, professional and knowledgeable throughout my journey.  They have been in business 30 years, and have never exhibited any prejudice against anyone.  I was homeless 18  months and they knew it, and helped me to get the best products for my needs to keep me functioning during that time.

Due to my chronic babesia flares,  i have been unable to wear a mask during the ongoing pandemic, and all of the staff have been very helpful getting my products and bringing  them out to my vehicle.  I love the fact that they care about their customers and have gone above and beyond during this time to make sure that those of us who are immune compromised have the natural treatments we need even if we are unable to wear a mask.

Additionally, i love their knowledge.  When i have a weird symptom that im not sure what to do about, they give me suggestions, as well as warnings on contraindications. Both in person and via Facebook.   Healthwise is where i send everyone!

resp.text: Thank You so much for your review Rosemary! You have come along way on your life's journey living with Lyme's and I am so proud to see how much you've learned and shared with so many others dealing with the many trials that come along with it. I enjoy our frequent talks and updates both in person and on FB...and we've had  quite a few over the years! Hopefully we won't have to deal with face mask issues for too much longer...I guess time and common sense will tell. Let me know how your doing with the Kroger Kit protocol. Thanks again for being such a great role model for those with Lyme!

name: Dora J Crow
text: I’ve been shopping at Healthwise for many years, since way before they expanded. I’ve seen them grow into a welcome presence in the natural homeopathic all in one stop shop they are today. They offer so much more than vitamins & minerals. Fresh organic sustainable food, and dry goods that rival any large grocery store. I’ve bought probiotics, prebiotics, vitamins, minerals, alkaline water and so much more. They offer local products too, like honey and candles. The personalized one on one service they offer is above and beyond any local store. They are kind, compassionate and helpful to anyone asking questions when faced with so many choices. Anything and everything they ever suggested for me helped me so much. Now, with the Covid-19, they are asking people to wear masks in the store or plan to call ahead and order what you need and they will bring it out to you, curbside. People complaining they cannot wear a mask have the alternative to call from their car, make an order and literally in seconds they bring it to your car. I also have health issues where I cannot breath if I wear a mask. I ordered a couple minutes before reaching their store and had my purchase soon as I pulled into the parking lot. I don’t understand people thinking the store staff try to push only the products that they use themselves. They have not done that to me in all my times in store. Well. That doesn’t include the time they suggested some tasty tea, though. All in all, there’s not another place around that offers what Healthwise Foods does. Check them out for yourself. Call or visit them today! Check out their local honey and candles!

resp.text: Thank You Dora for your great review! We appreciate you sharing your experiences while shopping with us for the many years we've had the pleasure of assisting you. I am so glad you mentioned the outside curbservice available for those who either forgot their facial covering or have some issue where they can't tolerate the mask for certain reasons. Will be glad when the new batches of honey become available soon. The candles are such a nice product to have on hand for your own enjoyment or as great gifts...made from the beeswax that the honey comes from at Sweet Bee. Very green oriented to not waste the beeswax and make a great product at the same time! Thanks again for sharing your experiences and helping with the awareness of the common sense in using a facial covering at this time!

name: Pam Lowe

resp.text: Thank you for your review Pam...appreciate you!

name: Danny Randolph
text:
If you are serious about your health you need not go anywhere else. Healthwise is the store you have been searching for!

I have shopped at Healthwise for over 15 years. The owners stay on the leading edge of knowledge related to health and nutrition. They are always available to assist you with answering your questions. They have never rushed me and they take the time to answer all my questions. I trust them for their extensive knowledge of nutritional and holistic treatments and practices.

Additionally, I trust them to validate and verify that their suppliers are actually providing the product identified on the package. Many large chain stores and grocery stores sell brands that are nothing but sawdust and powder. You can be confident you are getting the product on the label. They also sell grass-fed beef and other meat products that are healthy for you -- not full of hormones and antibiotics.

The owners require their staff members to train on which herbs or supplements would be the best solution to address whatever health condition you are trying to treat. The staff is very friendly and they are right there to help you if you have a health related question, or you can't find a product you are looking for.

I realize the are other health stores in the local marketplace. I have stepped into some of them as I was driving around town. I was curious about their knowledge of health and nutrition, the suppliers they purchased from, and the prices they were charging for the different products I regularly purchase. I could not find any store who could match the knowledge of owners and staff at Healthwise. The range of products were usually not as extensive as Healthwise and the prices were comparable to Healthwise.

I trust the owners of Healthwise and the quality of the products they sell. I will continue to purchase my health related items from them!

text: Lovely little juice bar with a great menu of healthy, organic foods, smoothies and juices. The staff is super friendly and helped my make a good choice since it was my first time. Indoor and outdoor seating available and they have an app so you can order on the go.

text: Protein toast was ON POINT! Also love the salads and all the juices and milks! I would love to add a photo, but I ate it too fast 😁

resp.text: Hey Christine, glad you liked it!

name: Nicole Havel
text:
I will say the food is delicious and clean and the juices are great. The building is spotless, and the workers are nice.
However, I asked for both my juices to be light ice or no ice (I don’t like ice). I proceeded to be charged $5.50 more for each juice, totaling $14.25 per juice. I had ordered two juices and a toast, and, with a 25% tip, my total came out to $50. I was like excuse me? I asked for a receipt and was like there’s no way I’m paying $5.50 extra each drink for asking for light ice/no ice. Just give me less juice. So ultimately I had to ask for a refund. $8.75 is a lot for a juice to begin with so to put it bluntly don’t come here on a budget.
I cook solely organic / grass fed / free range food. I know the costs are higher, but not that high. This place is a racket.

resp.text: Hey Nicole, we’re glad you like the food and the shop. As you know, premium organic food is expensive to source but it is the best for your health. Thanks for the feedback about extra juice pricing. Unfortunately that is what it costs us. I’ll be sure to reiterate with our team to make sure guests know there’s an added cost for that.

name: William Brend
text: Absolutely fresh and delicious!!  Definitely recommend the Hardcore One if you love your veggies in a juice.

resp.text: Thanks! Glad you liked it!!

name: b H
text: I’ve had a pleasant experience each time I’ve visited the Greystone location. The interaction was very minimal but nice enough. I’m definitely hooked and have decided to make Clean Juice a part of my daily routine.

name: Lorenzo Carter
text: Im sad to complain that today was the first bad experience I've had at Clean Juice. I reported the incident to the manager Savanah, to no avail. Usually when entering the store its very pleasant and warm. Today when I came in it was very different. The lady at the register appeared to be annoyed and upset. She never asked if she could help me, she didn't speak, no smile or anything. She didn't say anything to me until I asked her a question about the menu. I don't know her name but she stood out to me because she was the only tall black young lady working. I told the manager it was frustrating to me because being a black man myself, i didn't expect to be treated that way by her. I have always been treated so nice and warm any other time I come in the store. I have written the corporate office and will follow up with them as soon as possible because after talking to the manager Savanah she let me know that her friendship with her employee was very strong...which let me know that I should not hold my breath for an apology.

name: Jennifer Pidgeon
text: Today was my first visit to Clean Juice off 280.  I had the Longevity One smoothie, and it was really good and filling.  I bought some cold-pressed juices that I can't wait to try.  The staff was friendly and knowledge about the ingredients and health benefits.  I'm looking forward to trying the Greenoa Bowls, wraps, and toasts.  I will definitely go back and do recommend it.

resp.text: Hey thanks for coming in! Glad you liked it. We hope to see you again soon.

name: Amy Farren
text: I got "The Spring One" smoothie, and it tasted like frozen water essentially. I thought I was getting Covid or something when I tried it, because there was no taste. Then I tried my son's Berry Bowl, and it was delicious. I have no problem paying high prices for organic food, but I would for it to at least taste good. I guess I just won't ever order their smoothies and stick to the acai bowls.

text: The store was immaculate and love the worship music playing. The girls were so sweet and made our product perfect! Thank God for a truly healthy food in Greystone. I will be back for sure!

name: David Aaron Sheetz
text: DO NOT GO HERE IF YOU VALUE COVID-19 PRECAUTIONS. First I'll start with saying they have a sign that specifically asks for Yelp and Google reviews so here you go! The two employees working were both maskless this specific time I visited Clean Juice. I have been here on and off throughout the pandemic and have seen masks being worn sometimes and not others...Why can't this place enforce the ONE THING that scientists have PROVEN is effective? Why can't they stay consistent with their policies? This is grade A poor business management. Also there is a statewide mandate still active. USE LOGIC AND REASON OR LOSE MY BUSINESS. Food is great, don't kill your business by failing your employees and customers.

resp.text:
Hey David,
Our policy is for employees to wear masks. We will continue to have this policy until the governor drops the mandate. Thanks for feedback.

name: Dawn Willett
text: The coffee smoothie was delicious. The staff is very friendly.

resp.text: Thanks Dawn!

text: Their product is excellent, but pricey.  They are limiting their potential with a lot of the “in your face” religious stuff scattered throughout the store. name: Alisa Poole

resp.text: Thanks Alisa! Glad you like it.

name: Nicholas Gregory
text: Wow what a staff! First time here, walked me through everything and gave recommendations. The owner of this location is very lucky to have this level of employees.

name: Marissa Miller
text: Had been a few times before the pandemic and the manager always was able to help me and describe why certain things are good for me and helped me greatly with learning what to put into my body. He always made good conversation and made me feel important and like they cared about my health. I came back the other day after learning they reopened and had a horrible experience. I asked about nutritional benefits and differences in proteins and they just tried to hand me a nutritional pamphlet and could not answer any specific questions about their products . I asked to speak to the man I normally spoke to and that he was the manager and I couldn’t remember his name.I was informed he was fired and I was talking to one of the managers who took his place. She was maybe 15-17 which makes no sense to me. She had no clue what she was talking about with regards to their menu and did not really help me at all and seemed angry that I was asking so many questions. After I finally ordered she left for another employee to make my smoothie and even the employee joked and  said don’t worry we miss our manager too! I laughed but was also semi shocked by that. I Was a regular now I will not be back.

resp.text: Hey Marissa, we are so sorry you didn't have a good experience. While we strive to always be able to answer the questions our guests need, many times our team may have to reference a guide book to give the proper answer. I believe we are all a little rusty as we navigate opening back up after all the craziness hit. Our goal is to always be learning. Again, we are sorry you had a negative experience and we do hope to see you back in in the future. If you do decide to come back in (which we hope you do), your next one will be on us.

name: Brad Louis
text: This place has gone way downhill since they reopened. It was great when they first opened always had good service, so I don’t know what happened maybe they changed management.

name: Alda Her
text: I love this place ❤️🥰 they have wonderful juices, smoothies and salads!! Always the friendliest service and delicious, healthy food choices. My goal is to try EVERYTHING on the menu 😂

resp.text: Hello Alda, Thanks so much for the kind words and feedback. If you need some help choosing what to try next, let us know. We're happy to help.

name: Erika VM
text:
Im very disappointed. I’m in 50s and trying so hard to stay healthy and keep my mask on in public. Where I live in AL, today we had the highest COVID spike on record. None of your three servers had masks and looked oblivious to my question (polite) why they didn’t. We are in the middle of a pandemic. I stated this concern on their ig and they blocked me. As they say below, posting on their ig concerns is not in their opinion acceptable. As any business knows,  social media is where people can comment positive or negative concerns. If companies delete anything that is not glowing it shows a refusal to truly address customer concerns. Why not publicly state your official policies. Any successful co will allow feedback —good or bad— so long as it’s not vulgar.  This refusal to care about customers health,  and then to not reply reasonably to feedback is not acceptable. There is no admission in your reply to me that there is any policy re this public health matter. Im appalled as a franchise that you allow this and I’m quite upset. I was a regular but no more. It appears that teenagers unmasked are calling the shots. If you are in the food industry in AL and watching the news you need to realize that this is unsafe.These unmasked kids have parents and grandparents and can be asymptomatic and pass it on to them, others and your customers. The employee stated “we don’t have to wear them.”  You are now saying they do?? It’s not clear. Did you change your policies yesterday? Was the employee making that up? For a store that prides itself on health, this is the biggest health crisis we have faced as a country in many many years.
This was the Greystone store in AL .

resp.text: Hello Erika, Thank you so much for your feedback. I'm sure you're aware that an Instagram post about our new app isn't the best place to give feedback about masks. Thats why the comments were deleted. Thank you for bringing your feedback here. Our staff has been wearing masks for most of the time since we've reopened and we will continue to wear masks as long as people are concerned over this matter.

name: Leslie Dollar

name: Charlie Boy
text:
Oh Whole Foods, what has gone wrong? Whelp, the employees were great. Helpful, polite, and soft spoken. I greatly appreciate good customer service, which saved y'all from a one star.

Pros: Clean, well lit, good customer service.

Cons: The fact I could Smell cooked bacon and sausage throughout the store, but there was none to be found.
The prosciutto was grey and looked dried out.
The muffins were bland, and what's worse, the chocolate on the double chocolnate muffins had bloomed, which meant that it had gone bad and would taste disgusting.
The big bakery department was gone. No more wall of delicious breads to enjoy.

As Whole Foods go it's average. The selection is the same, the spaced out well lit isles are the same. It's the little things that set them apart for the better or worse. In this case there's room for improvement guys.

resp.text: Hi Charles, thanks for your honest feedback regarding the Huntsville store. We've gone ahead and shared your experience with our internal team for their review. We hope to welcome you back again soon.

Called the manager, told her my story no problem come back in for a refund. Saved my $40. Talked to the Pizza Dept Manager expressed my feelings. Reason no taste they measure the save out and the cheese can't be over on account of their pizza ovens, guess bezo doesn't have enough funds to just layer the sauce and get the proper ovens. I would recommend stay away , waste of money there not cheap. They lost the soul of a pizza by measuring! Terrible waste of my time , do not order the pizza just ask for the box to go I'm sure it will taste far better.

text: Sorry for the long post. I  want to take a moment to say how grateful I am that whole foods delivers all the way out to my neighborhood. I did a pickup order from Walmart yesterday because there are a few things I just can't get at whole foods that I can at Walmart. The pickup window I chose was between 4:00 to 5:00 p.m. they sent me a message at 4:00 saying my groceries were delayed. 6: 00 p.m. they send me another email saying my groceries are ready to pick up so I sent my husband to go get them. After 30 minutes of him waiting I called Walmart and the poor department head (which I felt really bad for him) Said that he walked into a mess and he had been working 14 hours that day. I asked him how long he thought it would be for my groceries to come out to the car and he told me he honestly had no idea. I asked him to go ahead and just cancel my order and my husband came home. About 7:00 to 8:00 p.m. I went on to whole foods and placed my order and my groceries were here the next morning. Long story short I will not be shopping at Walmart anymore way to go whole foods!

name: Owen Eason
text: Helpful staff.

name: Felecia Hives
text: I can shop and charge my car, thanks

name: Peter H
text: I like many of the options this store has to offer, however, the experience of checkout is always a hassle.  It makes me consider more convenient options. For example, I feel like they never have enough cashiers and the entire process has been a bottleneck or at the very least, a slow experience almost everytime I go.  Lunch time usually being the most difficult.

resp.text: We appreciate the feedback about the long lines at check out, Peter. We'll pass this along to store leadership so they can review staffing issues during busy times.

name: Melissa Escamilla
text: Music, atmosphere, & delicious eats makes trying new foods exciting!

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome review, Melissa!

name: Jeff McKinney
text: Store was clean and orderly, as always, with a knowledgeable and helpful staff. On of the few grocers in Huntsville where you will find 100% COVID safety compliant staff and most customers who are smart enough to voluntarily comply with masking and sanitizing.

name: Andee D
text: Too expensive. It is ridiculous

name: Marion Studer
text: Very nice store.  Prices are a bit high, but very nice produce.  Store is very clean and staff very helpful.

name: Paul Stoneking
text: Always has what I am looking for.

name: Kimberly Norris
text: This grocery store in my place of choice for buying wine and meat. They have local and grass fed meat that you can really taste the difference and freshness. Much larger wine selection than other grocery stores in the area

resp.text: We appreciate the wonderful review, Kimberly!

name: katandthefids everything2cellos
text: I love this store. I just always spend too much money here. Disappointed in how they let their hot food bar decline. It used to have so much good stuff, now it seems to be all pork and chicken....

name: Christina Morgan
text:
This whole foods had an awesome pizza joint that makes custom order pizzas in a really cool pizza oven! Their selection is great, and the staff was awesome and friendly. I enjoyed their pretty extensive wine collection and the great olive bar. There are lots of prepared foods if you're looking for a quick lunch or an easy dinner.

This is one of my favorite Whole Foods that I've ever been to. It's in a fairly new shopping center and the store itself is bright and very clean. You can't go wrong with this store if you are into this type of store in general.

name: AhRayah Raash
text: Good service but not as over friendly as most Publix staff for a comparison.   Great selection of groceries and the buffets are top notch.   Butcher shop is not one to return calls for orders it seems (multiple occasions).  Good store.

name: Paula Price
text: Wonderful place to buy all my plant based diet needs!!!

name: Leif L.
text: I don't think this place is for me. Prices are beyond expensive, quality of products is very high however. Service was great and friendly. Attached pizza place is extremely good. Would recommend the freshly made foods at the location over buying the normal grocery products.

name: Jesse Graham
text: This Whole Foods is in a great location, close to a bunch of good restaurants and stores. Really like coming here for some harder to find items. They carry some great coffees and the prices are not as horrific as you hear. Not a fan of the self service food bar, extremely bland, but the pizza and sushi bars make up for it. Recommend this store.

name: Paul M
text: What I only have to say is that their parking lot smell like a dump, and that’s always. 🤢🤮

name: Brooke Stidham
text: Love the staff at this store!

name: Ariel Marie
text: Love it!! Excellent prices and the best produce available in store!!! Love their food bars, love the beauty isle, love the spices!! Never been disappointed!!

name: April Mathews
text: I love this place!!!! The buffets that are available daily are wonderful.  The sushi bar is great,  the pizza is amazing... and that's just prepared food.  The produce department is absolutely beautiful.  There are so many organic options,  and so many things that you don't see in the "normal" grocery store. The health and beauty isles could be their own store because there are so many great products.  I'm so glad that Huntsville finally got a Whole Foods Market.

resp.text: Thank you for the review and kind words, April. We are glad you enjoy our store’s atmosphere and are happy that we are able to provide you healthy food options.

name: Taryn Horton
text: Always have a great experience there.  People are super polite. I wish there was one closer to my home.

resp.text: Thank you for the nice review, Taryn!

name: CGL Phattimus_Prime
text: I love this store. Everything I need is here, customer service is excellent and the produce is top-notch.

name: W3 S33 33
text: Not impressed with prepared foods at all.  Not great for anyone plant-based.  Produce is nice, but many of the better products like broccoli raab, Romanesco broccoli, purple cauliflower, prickly pear, etc. are no longer available.  Some products, such as Bragg Nutritional Yeast, take a long time to restock.  This could be due to a lack of availability and food shortages though.

resp.text: We appreciate your honest feedback. We will pass this along to our team and hope that the prepared foods will meet your expectations on your next visit. Please feel free to stop by our customer service desk to chat about concerns regarding produce inventory with our team members. We hope you give us another chance.

name: Chelsea Madisetty
text: Good cheese, bad beer. Went to get a specific blue cheese and they were out, however the lady at the cheese counter was very knowledgeable about her area, and told us when to call to see if they had gotten a shipment in. Afterwards we moved over to the beer area to purchase a growler and was ignored by the man working there. He actually walked past us to leave the counter, then came back a few minutes later and continued to ignore us for several minutes. We left without any beer.

resp.text: We appreciate you bringing this to our attention, Chelsea. We're sorry to hear about your customer service experience at our Huntsville location. Mind following up with us regarding this issue? Please use the provide link for additional assistance: www.wfm.com/help

name: Stacey Besherse
text: Great store.  Seems like prices on produce are getting more reasonable.  I don’t mind paying more to be able to trust in each item, but i have to have limits.

name: Erik Moss
text: My fiancee and I like to come and eat at the salad bar, it often has great healthy choices and we enjoy the options. However, after 6 pm the salad bar seems not to get refilled and I often end up showing up after work for dinner and leaving hungry...

resp.text: We're sorry you found an empty salad bar, Erik. Please contact us at wfm.com/help with any more details. We will be happy to look into this further!

name: Aditya Gurushankar
text: Nice place to shop

name: Louiese Nelms
text: Not helpful by staff. Clean store. Some customers not wearing masks.

name: Carmen Williamson
text: The this market, great healthy choices to choose from especially if you're trying to eat healthier, supplements etc. Great staff, very helpful abd kind.

resp.text: Thanks for the nice review, Carmen!

name: Hawk Knight
text:
Always like visiting one of these markets wherever I travel. Good selection of harder to find items not in your local supermarket.
Staff was very helpful each time I was there.
Prices are a little higher than your local market so expect it with the quality you get. I do not mind spending a little more on fruits and veggies that actually have flavor instead of picked green shelf rippened products.

name: J Olíval
text: This place was my lifeline while I was visiting from California 💗 very clean, very good selection, people working there were always very friendly

resp.text: That's music to our ears, Jay.  Thanks for the nice review!

name: Walker Dodson
text: I love shopping here. They have so many gluten free options for my wife. So much easier to shop here for someone with a Gluten intolerance.

name: Elizabeth Canty
text:
Struggling to understand what has happened with this WFM in the past two years, understaffing? The Amazon purchase?
Intended to be a good option for plant-based Huntsville-ians, I can rarely complete my shopping trip for fresh produce without also going to Publix (i.e. yesterday there were no salad kits, no Sweet Potatoes, no basil, and the broccoli I purchased was already soft and spongy). There is only ever a few registers open - only TWO yesterday during the after work rush. We have completely given up on the hot bar as well - I can't remember the last time it appeared freshly stocked or hot, unless you want meat dishes - they are clearly catering to a specific demographic....

name: Gabrielle Beverly
text: I like the store layout, doesn’t feel crowded. Employees are friendly and helpful

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Gabrielle! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Anita McCormick
text:
Good place to meet friends for lunch and do a little food shopping.
My only wish is...different chairs. Unless you're 12 yrs old or really small you have to sit forward or be smushed.
That being said so happy to now have a Whole Food.

name: dawn corsaw
text: Could stay in here for hours looking at their neat stuff!

resp.text: Thanks for being an awesome customer, Dawn!

name: Cindy Martin
text: Great shopping experience! 👍

name: Shanita Mccullough
text: I used the Amazon locked hub inside but the store was clean great atmosphere and very convenient when your on the go to pick up Amazon gifts.

name: Diane C
text: Absolutely the BEST pizza around!!!

resp.text: We're glad you enjoy our pizza! We hope to welcome you back again soon.

name: Lee Madkin
text: Good food. Healthy food.

resp.text: We're happy that you're happy, Lee!

name: Kait O
text: Awesome store just so dang pricey

name: Nyla McCoy
text: Great selection of fresh food at reasonable prices. Staple items are pricier than competition.

name: Andrea Crowder
text: I am really glad we have a Whole Foods here now. I don't shop for everything here. Some items can be found at other grocery stores and are overpriced here. The bakery is an amazing highlight. I have had some great cakes and other treats here. The environment is nice and I enjoy visiting.

name: Allison Hammond
text: Revising my review for the Huntsville location regarding communication. Someone got in touch with us soon after and we were able to resolve the issue. Great job from management!!

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention, Allison. We take all complaints and feedback seriously, so we would like to look further into this matter. Can you please contact us at www.wfm.com/help explaining any additional details and your contact information? Please also refer to this review in the email message, thanks.

name: Tracey Woolridge
text:
One bad apple can spoil everything. I have been been there a few weeks ago and the woman who rang up my items was distant and cold.

She was holding a conversation with the customer behind me she didn't put my items in a bag, and she couldn't look at me to hand me the receipt.  She just dangled it on the side making me reach for the receipt.

This isn't the first time I was looked down on in this store  I've smiled and said hello to one worker they just walked by rolled their eyes.  And another worker was telling me I couldn't pay for my items with my watch. I work with mobility for a living.

Now I have had some good experiences there. People have smiled and greeted me. I would even say the people at the bakery are wonderful. I would just suggest the people who are the face of Whole Foods work a little on the attitude.

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out, Tracy. We expect our team members to be courteous and respectful to each and every customer and we apologize that was not your experience. Do you mind sending a follow-up email to customer.questions@wholefoods.com with this information? One of our team members will be in touch. Thank you.

name: DanaTrains
text:
Be aware: the pinpoint doesn't point to the correct location on the map. There are so many different products that I can't find anywhere else here. This store allows me to cook and eat a very clean and healthy diet. You still have to understand that just because it's sold in Whole Foods doesn't mean it's healthy. I also don't really like their selection of produce. I think Fresh Market and Publix have the best produce selections. If they don't have something you need, ask and they can probably order it for you.

The best part about this store is the food bar. They have hot food as well as a salad bar. All the ingredients are listed which allows me to stay away from things I should not eat. More than that, everything tastes good! It's $8.99/pound so you have to be careful about how much you load onto your plate. But, if you don't eat it all you can get a lid and take it home.

name: Martin Pollard
text: It was a nice place and friendly

resp.text: We're happy to hear you had a pleasant shopping experience with us, Martin. Thanks for coming in!

name: Alex McCool
text: Prices can be steep, but they have a good variety of vegetarian substitutes, lots of hard to find fruits and veggies, a large bakery, good wine and beer selection, and short checkout lines.

name: Amber J
text: I wish whole foods offered more real organic/clean/non-gmo food options than it does, but this store location is great. I love the setup and the bath and body area! The staff is always friendly, and checkout is quick.

name: Leah Camp
text: Wide variety of organic and specialty foods. This location is newer, many options I haven't seen in other locations. Well organized, clean, and if you have difficulty finding an item, many employees are willing to help.

resp.text: We appreciate the positive review, Leah! We hope to see you shopping with us again very soon!

name: John Fishman
text: Not as good as when it first opened. Quality of food and esp breads has dumbed down to Huntsville Market. Every other Whole Foods I've ever been to us better.

name: Dennis C. Sibit
text: Never crowded great staff

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Dennis!

name: Paula Sirten
text: Always great! Try the granola bar that they have up front at the registers!

name: Chatsworth1979
text: Great hot food bar, though not as good lately.  Wide selection of everything in the store.  Bulk grains and spices. Amazon Locker at this location!! Electric Vehicle charging station available too.  Fresh produce, some locally sourced.  Nice vibe here.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review!

name: 13k_lxies
text: It's got food

name: Jon Sullivan
text: Ok

name: Kari Engle
text: Love the wide variety of food.

name: Robert Weaver
text: Not for everyday shopping for regular people. Probably more for millenials. Lots of organic and whole grain foods.

name: Georgia Grochowalski
text: Very clean and organized.Staff was very helpful, friendly  educated on products and easy to find.  Prices are high but worth it for the verity of products and the service you receive.. I recommend to all my friends especially vegetarians and those on special diets.

name: Patrick Fitzgerald
text: I usually go here for quality meats, fruits and vegetables. They have dry aged ribeyes, which are absolutely fantastic. The chicken is amazing as well. The fruit and vegetables are the best in town. It's a bit more expensive but definitely worth the little extra. There's a big difference in texture and taste and I'd rather have quality over quantity any day of the week.

name: Daniel Shrider
text: Whole Foods is a fantastic place to grab lunch,  especially if you're dieting. I gave them only 4 stars because I'm not so enthusiastic about buying groceries. Their prices are quite reasonable for lunch, but not so much for groceries.  However, there are very important items at Whole Foods that are very very hard to find elsewhere.  So my advise is to do most of your grocery shopping elsewhere, and go to Whole Foods for lunch,  supper, and those hard to find items that you need.

name: Rebecca Butz
text: Fresh and in-season produce. Everything in a store for which I could ask:  cheese department, bakery, pizza restaurant, bar, coffee shop, growler-fill-up, sandwich shop, quick/fresh sushi, fresh meat and seafood departments, fresh buffet, local goods, trustworthy brands, boutique, and really great customer service. I love how the employees always seem to be sporting their most unique and individual styles too - very inspiring to see a company that allows/supports individuality in the work place.

name: Arnell Austin
text: We love this store

resp.text: Thanks for the love, Arnell!

name: chantal freeman
text: Shop here all the time but lately its a mess. The fly situation at the buffet section is really bad and this is a constant problem. Used to get my dinner from the buffet but stopped doing that. This past week was going to get some cookies but inside the case where the cookies are kept saw small type of bugs crawling around and this is inside the case. That was it for me.

resp.text: We appreciate you bringing this to our attention, Chantal. We're sorry to hear about your experience with the prepared foods at our Huntsville location. Mind following up with us regarding this issue? Please use the provided link for further assistance: www.wfm.com/help

name: Tonya Johnson (Sunshine)
text: I love this place plenty of fresh meat and vegetables and fruits. The area with the hot and cold bars as well as the Bakery and Deli are pretty awesome.  The staff is very friendly, helpful, and will ensure you are able to find what you are looking for.

name: Chelsea Parsons
text: Nice selection. Love love love their fresh meat selection and prices especially when you catch a sale in that department. My husband and I love the discount cheese scrap basket. It's a nice way to try new cheeses without wasting cheese or money.

name: larry jones
text: Little on the expensive side, but but enjoy the food bars and pizza.

name: M. A. (Martha Ashton)
text: Nice store, good food, and nice employees, but I can't afford to shop there. On the plus side it's the only place in Madison County that I've found Dutch processed cocoa. Two of the five times I've visited, I've gotten to the register and had to put all of my items back. Pricing is very misleading: $$ per "portion" of fish (sold in packs of 4) & $$ per "ounce" for a prepackaged bath bomb? I don't understand, just put a direct price on the package so the consumer knows what it will be when they get to the register; I understand this is corporate policy. And I agree with others about sale prices, I've been overcharged before but customer service refunded the difference.

name: David Mullins
text: Great experience BUT EXTREMELY OVER-PRICED. they have some unique items BUT I WILL NOT RETURN. As I have heard said, name should be WHOLE PAYCHECK.

name: Dadul Maharaj
text: Thanks for the wide variety of vegan options. Keep in mind there are so many things that can be made vegan which even non vegans will love which targets a higher customer volume which creates bigger profits. Example; bakery products, nobody will refuse a cake, cookie or pastry that is missing eggs and dairy. " does this cookie have eggs?" Says no non vegan ever.

name: Kimberly Kennedy
text: Love this store. Check out the salad and hot bar while here.

name: Nicholas Pate
text: The extraordinarily wide beer selection was what we noticed first. Then the electric vehicle charger, making this the most convenient place for us to shop. Over time we found the produce is consistently extraordinary, and then noticed the bulk food bins... for the strategic and sometimes casual shopper/charger/feeling-like-a-pizza-and-pint-er, there's really a lot to like about Whole Foods.

name: kim rosario
text: Always find the organic food I need. For example Swiss chard. I can't find it anywhere else but here. Clean store and friendly staff

resp.text: Thanks for the positive review, Kim! We're glad you enjoyed your visit. We hope to see you soon!

name: Chazz M
text: Lots of fruit and vegetables, those looked great. Saw lots of options for snacks as well as individual and family meals. We went with an eye for easy things to serve for large groups and struggled to find anything ready to go. Lots of options for making things from scratch! But, this is not the best place to go for just picking up something already prepped for a large group.

name: Ava Hines
text: You need a pocket full of money if your going to buy a buggy full of groceries! Prettiest beef I've ever seen! Great looking seafood! Top notch products! Very friendly people ! Great experience over all but as I've said they are pretty expensive!!!

name: Keri S
text:
My first trip here made it seem like I'd never been in a store before. It was full of all these things we don't have in this tiny city's Walmart and stocked full with these super healthy and high-quality looking items along with a nice looking place to eat inside.

I've been many times since and Whole Foods always has what I can't find in other health food stores. They're always super friendly and helpful. The prices aren't as bad as I was expecting even though some things do cost more to be healthier. Everything I've gotten here has been of great quality and delicious.

name: Paula Sirten
text: Always great! Try the granola bar that they have up front at the registers!

name: Chazz M
text: Lots of fruit and vegetables, those looked great. Saw lots of options for snacks as well as individual and family meals. We went with an eye for easy things to serve for large groups and struggled to find anything ready to go. Lots of options for making things from scratch! But, this is not the best place to go for just picking up something already prepped for a large group.

name: larry jones
text: Little on the expensive side, but but enjoy the food bars and pizza.

name: Andrew Fandre
text: 10/13/2016 Whole Foods had a local beer tasting. All 9 Madison County breweries represented. Whole Foods community involvement makes me love their company. I also had a pizza I've never had before, a pulled pork bbk, roasted veggie pizza, drizzled with a spicy sauce. Very fun and delicious.

name: Preston Nance
text: On my visit, the customer service was outstanding, Shari Taylor, jalen made my grandsons day a smile as big as the Sun, we were looking for a very specific item and they went over and beyond,.

name: Kimberly Kennedy
text: Love this store. Check out the salad and hot bar while here.

name: Dave In Alabama
text: Always a good deal for lunch prices and has good fresh food

name: Robin Hollander
text: This market had wonderful whole fresh foods. A huge organic section,  delectable bakery delights.  A four steam table buffet with meats and vegetables. Definitely worth a visit

name: Michael Kulpa
text: Nice and clean, great fruit selection. Nothing new with prices a little higher than most.

name: Lori Bray
text: My son-in-law is the Manager and he does a great job.  The store is clean, the staff is very friendly, and the cheese guy is awesome.  He knows what cheeses go together and how to serve the.  Great store!!

name: Bruce Mitchell
text: Great variety of food options. Super friendly staff great lunch and quick dinner spot. Pizza, sushi, deli hot and cold food barS. Great tasting and healthy options.

name: Russ Howison
text: Beautiful location, fantastic food selection, and a fun place to visit even if you're not shopping. They also have a coffee shop, hot food bar and gourmet pizza oven with craft beers on tap.

name: Tia Wheeler
text: Really good hot and cold food bar, along with a pizza place. And the eating areas are really nice.

name: B Mckel
text: Yummm

name: Michael Kulpa
text: Nice and clean, great fruit selection. Nothing new with prices a little higher than most.

name: Lori Bray
text: My son-in-law is the Manager and he does a great job.  The store is clean, the staff is very friendly, and the cheese guy is awesome.  He knows what cheeses go together and how to serve the.  Great store!!

name: Kenneth Wrye
text: Like shopping at Whole Foods

name: Perfectly Studios
text: Nice place

name: Daryl Bauer
text: Couldn't stand the store more than 5 minutes horrible horrible smell!

name: C Baker
text: My husband and I are from out of town and not sure if we just don't look like we have a lot of money or what, but I cannot have dairy due to health reasons and this establishment offers many vegan options. This was our first time at this store and while browsing, i noticed a worker followed us everywhere we went, even as we exited the store. It made me feel so uncomfortable that I put my basket down along with the contents and we left. You should not make customers feel like criminals just because they don't fit the criteria of your normal customers.

name: Gary Saunders
text: Love this Whole Foods. Staff are always friendly and helpful. We go to get the Beyond Meat Burgers!

name: C Brown
text: The two young ladies that helped me were very helpful. Small section of product is the reason for my score more than anything.

name: Eduardo Saldana
text: Love this place, staff is very helpful and polite. The deli has delicious and food! Also best variety of beer. Come here atleast once per week, should come more often. Keep an eye out for their specials.

name: Renee Holder
text: Not surprising considering the quality. Their selection is outstanding. Their customer service is better than most.

name: Sonji Rainney
text: While visiting from Nashville Tennessee, I was very much looking forward to enjoying a great meal. But was disappointed to discover this location doesn't  carry the "vegan mock chicken" for purchase or in the wrap, which I'm accustom to back Nashville Tennessee.  Whole Foods needs to be consistent with Vegan products at all locations.

name: Todd Henrichs
text: Best fancy groceries in town. Good buffet for all 3 meals. Pizza place is solid too. The occasional beer dinners are a great value!

name: Nicky Beale
text: Like all the supplements but need to get rid of the plastic at the hot food bar, be the example Whole Foods!!

name: Charlotte M. Ellett (Charlaxy)
text: Great people! I love their specials. Their roast chicken is great. The best place for grass fed milk in the area.

name: Helga Weber-sledge
text: ALL IN ORDER ! FRIENDLY EMPLOYEES

name: Chandler Reynolds
text:
If you've been to Whole Foods before, then you know what to expect. If not, you will find lots of organic goods with price tags higher than their non-organic rivals at other stores.

Growler refills are cheap and they usually have a good selection of local beers to choose from!

name: Justin Malone
text: Their food bar is nothing short of amazing!  Exceptional quality and quite a variety.  Overall a wonderful grocery store with quality and fresh products.

name: Greg Mattson
text: Service was excellent. The staff went ahead of their way to get what I needed. Will definitely go back and Shop there again.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Greg! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Contessa Hudson
text: Large variety of vegan products.

name: Dave K
text: Very nice, modern store; I feel like I am on the west coast when there. Lots of selection and lots of items one simply cannot get anywhere else in town. The prices are a bit lower now that Amazon owns the chain though still higher than anywhere not called "Publix"

name: GOLDBULLIONTREASURES
text: I love to get herbal tea mixtures here and then make my own blend.

name: Hightide89
text: Clean big store. Lots to choose for lunch. The organic foods market makes me think the country is a bunch of pansies and we are doomed.

name: Lisa Potter
text: I really only come to WF for the grassfed beef and while I love that, I do not like your employees. They always act like you are bothering them and I can never understand why sometimes I go in and my phone number works and other times I’m told it doesn’t for the extra 10% off deal. I had an employee that was so hateful tell me it wasn’t going to take my number so I said forget it. Another time this girl packed ALL of my groceries in one bag and told me I better hold my hand under it so it doesn’t bust. It’s always something like that every time I go in. Also, you charge $6.99 for organic strawberries when I can get them at Publix organic for $3.99. That’s ridiculous and why I don’t come out with other items. Very overpriced.

resp.text: Hi Lisa, thank you for bringing this to our attention. We're sorry to hear about your experience and would like to look into this. Would you mind sending us an email at www.wfm.com/help?

name: Kreigan Hopkins (Antherian)
text: Tea selection is nice, we also like the get sushi from here occasionally.

name: Gregg Wright
text: Very short and dismissive. Really? At those prices I'll order online. Sorry for asking a question..?

name: Susan Short
text: Awesome products and awesome people!

name: Mark Faine
text: This is probably the only place in town where I can get a great vegan pizza.  They don't skimp on ingredients, they are willing to remake a pizza if it's not up to your standards, and every ingredient is the highest quality, no cheap ingredients at all. The whole wheat pizza crust is so good as to be almost as good as the white, it's a hardly noticeable difference for most pizzas.  I'm only holding back one star since I would like to see a few more options for vegans (vegan protein options for toppings, calzones, pan pizza, etc.)

name: Jeremy Concepcion
text: Their buffet is one of the only consistent places in Huntsville to get healthy, organic food that rotates frequently and doesnt break the bank. Plus you can drink beer whilst shopping.

name: Mitze Dunn
text: The store looked clean and smelled nice. I liked the way it was organized. The store associates were great.

name: Ashley K Oak
text: Don’t come here for smoothies, they apparently don’t make them even though their website has a full menu

resp.text: We appreciate you bringing this to our attention, Ashley. We're sorry to hear about your experience at our Huntsville location. Mind following up with us regarding this issue? Please use the provided link for further assistance: www.wfm.com/help

name: Mitzi Farley
text: Lunch there from salad bar was great!

name: Curtis Clemons
text: Grape variety of food

name: Dorothy Peters
text: Great Whole Foods!  They have a very large selection of basically everything you could need.  Also LOVE that they have an electric car charging station :)

name: Mr. Rock N' Roll
text: Only went to try the pizza place in the store it was amazing and there are some beautiful woman that shop there too!

name: vidalia jewel
text: Nice store. Great bakery and coffee bar

resp.text: We're happy to hear that you enjoy our bakery and coffee bar! We hope to see you soon.

name: Teresa Fowler
text: I love the selection of meats, to include lamb and buffalo, they have in store; they even dry-age beef on-site.  The bone-in grass-fed ribeye steaks I got there were absolutely delicious! They also have a beautiful selection of fruits and vegetables, some not found anywhere else in Huntsville.  I will definitely keep shopping there.

name: Steph M
text: The vegan options at the hot bar were so sad. It was sweet potatoes and an Indian dish. The menu seems to regional because there was a lot of meat. When I stay I the huntsville area I'll have to make sure to get a hotel room with a kitchen because of this.

name: Tom Thompson
text: Great place to get your vitamins and health products

name: J B
text:
This review is for Whole Foods at north parkway.
Hello everyone, today me and my wife went there to get some food and let me tell you the food is 100% tasteless. There is literally NOT ONE DROP OF FLAVOR...NOT ONE. we got ourselves a couple of food plates from the bar, I was hungry believe I pack the plate but I wished I had taste the food. I got myself a plate of beef brisket and lots of rice, it was so tasteless that I just threw it away in the second bite.  Whoever cooks back there need some cooking lessons BADLY....BADLY, SALT, PEPPER,.......WHAT'S HAPPENING PEOPLE??? cook with love or please go home. TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE.

name: Thelonious Jazzman
text:
Vegan pizza is outstanding. Anna made our pizza. Brittany was our waitress. Both were EXCELLENT! I took a picture of Brittany and think that I posted it. (Google Maps platform odds not the easiest to figure out.] Both young ladies were the BEST! Brittany was attentive without being obnoxious. Thidenticalanks for a great casual dining experience! Craft beers were excellent. Try before you buy. I had Lawyers, Guns and Money. Just right. Not too bitter. And Molotov Cocktail. Almost identical
Both had great full-bodied taste. L,G and M was darker not not too heavy. Both lightly sweet. Excellent food, excellent beer, excellent service. FIVE STARS!

text: A medium sized Whole Foods. Not as much choice in hot foods on the bar as some, but foes have a pizza restaurant with craft beers and a small Japanese vendor. Great quality of vegetables, fruits, and meats in grocery.

name: Melissa Summers
text: I am so so pleased. I wanted something healthy and the Food Preparer was beyond helpful. He recommended a "bowl" that was delicious. He accommodated all of my special requests of quinoa, daiya cheese and avocado. The bowl consisted of pinto beans, quinoa, jackfruit 'barbeque', avocado which he so kindly mashed up at my request, romaine lettuce and pumpkin seeds. DELICIOUS. Remarkable service.

resp.text: We are glad to hear about your great experience! Thank you for the nice review, Melissa! 💚💚💚

text:
My family has been shopping at Whole Foods in over 6 locations for the last 15 years and this is the worst run store ever.  We ALWAYS get overcharged on an average of 6 items when shopping our weekly run, and many which are SALE items.  On average it is an unfriendly group working there, the store is empty compared to most Whole Foods right before lunch and one or two tellers open.  We used to eat on site at the salad bars and you have to wait forever to get help behind the counter. The bagger we had recently was horrible, broken eggs, cold stuff with dry products, heavy things on breakables, ripped bags, literally just tossing products in the bags no rhyme or reason.  We mentioned this to him and he stared into space.
No apologies if they mess up or cause inconvenience to us.
Many things we purchase regularly are not on the shelves.  Overall a unpleasant experience and we are really disappointing in how this store is run.  Hope they straighten up soon or this store will not make it!

name: Katie Sunshine
text: I LOVE this store. The staff is super stellar! Some of the cashiers know us and it's sometimes hard to decide which checkout line to choose...I want to say hi to all our WF friends! WF has this awesome policy that if a product rings up incorrectly, you automatically get the item for free. The cashiers sometimes take this one step further---any complaints we've had about something we've bought (we bought some expired hummus once...we were overcharged once...etc) have been taken care of with a replacement---no questions asked. Also, WF is willing to track down and order items you're interested in. Not only that, but they then tend to keep that item in stock! :) The only thing I can't give a positive review of is their buffet. While there are plenty of options at the buffet---even for vegans, the food just isn't that good. And it's a bit pricey. Twice we have eaten there, and twice we have been disappointed. Still, this doesn't take away from the WF experience. I love shopping here, I love finding new items, and I love the feeling of friendliness every staff member radiates.

name: Emily C.
text:
When you think of Whole Foods,  you think crunchy granola wannabes,  right? Well if you don't feel like dying from a massive heart attack like virtually every other southerner,  I'd highly recommend trying out the interesting fruits and veggies they have to offer. *Also see below for another reason Whole Foods can save your life.*

Sometimes there are great deals (local items like premium shitake mushrooms and living lettuce) but then there are overpriced things that sound awesome but are out of a normal person's budget.

*sidenote from above*: For single,  educated heterosexual men looking for a significant other (shoot I think there are options for homosexual men too),  there are many good looking, in shape, educated women who shop here.  They obviously already have their crap together and you know they will have a good body for reproducing (a lot better than women hanging out in nasty clubs in downtown Huntsville or strip clubs in Atlanta),  just start focusing your attention there.  Then muster up the courage to ask some questions about a weird fruit or vegetable.  You are very welcome.

The fifth star will be added when I can afford all the delicious vegan cheese.

name: Jennifer Mc
text:
"It's okay" does indeed describe what is a below par Whole Foods Market.  By now, it's been open 4 months or so and I will assume has hit its stride.

The hot bar/salad bar area is definitely below average.  It's been the same dried out meat, sweet potatoes and other southern items ever since it opened and the variety is lackluster at best.  Did I mention the meat is always dried out?

The labels on the hot/salad bar are not always there and I don't trust the ingredients.  The stir fry obviously contained vegetables that weren't on the label - I believe bamboo shoots.  Coupled with missing labels, the degree of confidence in the food is mediocre.

The asian rice bowl and mexican food sections are decent as well.  It's a bit disappointing to me that they use dark meat chicken for both places.  Again, the meat did not look fresh either.  At the rice bowl, they couldn't answer questions as far as ingredients for people with food allergies.

Lastly, the selection in the actual store itself is significantly smaller than other Whole Foods in Atlanta and Nashville.  While not every special snowflake request can be satisfied for food allergies, their depth and breadth of gluten free products was disappointing.  No gluten free croutons and other limited options are not what I would have expected in a Whole Foods.  The new Walmart neighborhood market had an equally competitive selection for less price.

So overall, compared to other Whole Foods, this one is.. bleh.  The layout is significantly smaller than the Whole Foods in Franklin, TN and the selection is limited.  It is simply not that impressive for its reputation.
